definition: to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life

to return/to go back to/to give back to/(of a responsibility) to be taken care of by/to belong to/to gather together/(used between two identical verbs) despite/to marry (of a woman) (old)/division on the abacus with a one-digit divisor

sentences.english: We won't have Nesta, Dida, Serginho or Favalli until after the break, Gattuso is recovering well and could be back before the break.
sentences.chinese: 而加圖索也在很快的恢復，他也將在冬歇期過後歸隊。

sentences.english: However Emmanuel Eboue and Alex Song have been in this morning.
sentences.chinese: 不過，埃布艾和宋今早歸隊了。

sentences.english: Yao just came back to the team.
The gunfire stopped after Zhang Fugui sent to search, Liu Han take people back.
sentences.chinese: 槍聲停後張富貴派人去搜查，劉漢帶人歸隊。

sentences.english: Vidic is not due back at United until the end of this month having taken part in the World Cup.
sentences.chinese: 本月底參加完世界盃維迪奇才可能歸隊曼聯。

sentences.english: Fletcher also had words of praise for Ashley Young, who returned from injury to play a central role behind Dimitar Berbatov.
sentences.chinese: 弗萊徹也表揚了楊，他傷愈歸隊之後打得是攻擊中場。

sentences.english: We want everyone back but hopefully I can keep doing well.
sentences.chinese: 我們希望每個人都能歸隊，但希望我能表現好。

sentences.english: It is one of those niggly ones. He came back and had a recurrence.
sentences.chinese: 現在重要的是他受傷了，但他還會精神百倍的歸隊。

sentences.english: Qian red find DingShi brothers, called for a people back.
sentences.chinese: 芊紅找到丁氏兄弟，號召二人歸隊。

sentences.english: We have a big test today with Senderos, he could be back.
sentences.chinese: 我們今天有對森德羅斯的重要體檢，他可能會歸隊。

sentences.english: When Manu returns he will have to fight for his place in the first team too.
sentences.chinese: 當阿穆歸隊時，他也要爲他的位置而戰鬥。

definition: to heal a wound/to recuperate (from an injury)
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
to mess sth up/to screw up
(in classical literature) young military officer of high rank for his age/(during the Cultural Revolution) young militant in the Red Guard/(in modern usage) rising star (in sport, politics etc)
